summary: Configure and route filesystem backends for deep agents with policy enforcement, including built-in and custom options.
Deep Agents CLI is an interactive terminal for building agents with persistent memory, supporting various operations like file handling, shell commands, web search, and more.
Learn to enhance deep agents' functionality through customization using system prompts, tools, and subagents.
The agent harness offers a core tool calling loop with built-in capabilities for efficient agent execution, including file system access and task delegation.
Configure human approval for sensitive operations using LangGraph's interrupt capabilities, handling various decision types and tool calls.
Explains extending deep agents with persistent memory across threads using CompositeBackend for hybrid storage.
Introduces a modular middleware architecture for deep agents, supporting planning, filesystem operations, and subagent task delegation.
Overview of building complex task agents using the deepagents library, including planning, subagents, and file system capabilities.
Guide to building a research deep agent with planning, file system tools, and subagent capabilities.
Explains the use, configuration, best practices, and troubleshooting of subagents for task delegation and context management.
